poem:
**The Longevity of Misjudged Notes**

In the glow of critics' lamps,  
we found fault in its beating heart,  
notes tossed on the cobblestone,  
a story slipping through our grasp.  
  
Yet, like sun through morning fog,  
the world heard the timeless call—  
hope wrapped in a borrowed tune,  
staging the souls of the unheard.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Les Misérables: a musical full of heart and hope that continues to defy its critics So were we wrong? All the statistics suggest we misjudged popular taste. Since it began the show has been seen by more than 130 million people, has played in 57 countries". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
